content:
Hello. I'm getting the following error when running ./x.py test:

Error: "HTML check failed: 837563 errors"

Is this a known issue? If not, could compiling on aarch64-apple-darwin have something to do with it?
Yes, /usr/bin/tidy is ancient on Macos, see #90663. You can get a newer one via Homebrew.
Also, FWIW, it's usually faster to just run tests relevant to the code you're working on. E.g., if you're changing a rustc error message, ./x.py test src/test/ui.
I know, I just have a habit of running all the tests to verify my dev env from time to time. :)
